text: In organic chemistry, benzenedicarboxylic acid is a systematic name for a chemical with a benzene ring attached to two carboxylic acid groups. This chemical has three structural isomers, depending on how far apart the acid groups are on the ring: * Phthalic acid, when the groups are next to each other * Isophthalic acid, when they are one carbon apart * Terephthalic acid, when they are opposite each other Name Phthalic acid Isophthalic acid Terephthalic acid Structure
title: Benzenedicarboxylic acid
